Reviews.Title: “Very good for what it is...”
Reviews.Author: BritishDavid
Reviews.Content: The positives: * Staff are very friendly and helpful - everyone I met, from the reception staff to the people at breakfast, was great * Large and comfortable rooms - far bigger than you'd expect for the money * Very clean - room was cleaned thoroughly every day * Nice location - a km or two from the main tourist areas, but right my a Metro station, and with some great neighbourhood bars, restaurants and shops around you - try 'Velodrome', a 10-minute walk aay, for some of the best tapas you'll ever eat! * Great breakfast buffet - enough to set you up for the day! * Some nice touches - free wi-fi being the best The not-so-great * My room was a little shabby. Nothing terrible, but the furniture and decor were quite tired * The shower's pretty weedy; again, not a huge deal * Room service restricted to just a few hours each evening * The noise. Others have mentioned this, but the noise insulation is poor. I stayed on the top floor and could hear doors closing and toilets flushing downstairs. It wasn't as bad as some hotels, but if you're super-sensitive to noise, take earplugs! All in all, a great, friendly and decent-value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PH_KP
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in hotel Rekord. We've been here in January 2009 and really liked the hotel. At that time there were only a few visitors and our general impression was very good. Over the last 1,5 years we've stayed in more than 15 hotels all over Europe and ... maybe we got spoiled a bit. Maybe our standards got up a bit... When we arrived last week our first contact with the reception lady was fantastic. She was very friendly and even spoke a few words of Duch. But when we arrived in the junior suite we were a little bit dissapointed. The furniture was old, a sofa with a few stains, some humidity-stains on the wall (in the corner). The bathroom was really outdated and the biggest problem: you can hear all your neighbours (when they walk around, when they use the shower or toillet, when they open a door, even when they move a chair). You definetely need earplugs to get some sleep here. The next morning the noice pollution started round 6 AM ... I have to say the 2nd and 3th night the hotel was much more quiet ... so maybe our 1st-night-neighbours were to blaim. The breakfast is sober, but really tasty and very clean. The breakfast lady is so friendly and nice. The hotel offers free laptops, printers, umbrellas, etc... Each day somebody comes to your room with the weather forecast for the next day. After a 3-night stay our review is: maybe 1 star too much because it is a bit outdated and rather noicy, but this hotel has a very helpful and friendly staff. Because of this staff we might consider coming back to this hotel on our next visit to amazing Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Best service I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: FQL_Travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rekord is a very small hotel with just 17 rooms spread over 6 floors. The lobby, the breakfast room and the rooms themselves are very nice, modern design, state-of-the-art. Only the elevator and the stairs as well as some of the bathrooms could get a face-lift, but other than that very modern boutique hotel. The service is unbelievable: you have internet for free, breakfast is superb, between 5 and 9 pm there is coffee and cookies for free, you can get a hometrainer for your room, ... this makes it a very special atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steviek49
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 11 night European family vacation. We booked this hotel for a 1 night/2 room post cruise stay. We arrived early and one room was immediately available. We took our luggage to the one room and started to get settled in. The woman at the front desk Norlyn was fantastic. She offered our family access to the free breakfast even though we were only staying one night. Our room came with breakfast and VAT included. She also gave us laptop computers to use in both rooms. Our two teenage daughter immediately went on the internet to catch up on the past 10 days. The rooms were big, very modern and clean. Although the mattresses were abit thin we were quite comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood in/near the business district. The service here is top notch. Fresh fruit was brought to our rooms during the day. We took a taxi to the La Rambla and shopped on our last day in Europe. I highly recommend this hidden gem of a hotel to anyone who wants a quiet, modern, service oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: pek1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rekord for one night. I thought I'd treat myself to a nice 4 star hotel after a long trip from Tokyo. Unfortunately, it was not the treat I had been hoping for. The hotel has a small but nice entrance & check-in desk. The rooms are spacious, but unfortunately also a bit noisy (a toilet being flushed on a higher floor can be heard lound and clear in the room) and not extremely clean (found some hair from the previous visitor on the bathroom walls) The view from my room was pretty lousy, to be honest, and breakfast was not that great either: not everything was fresh, the buffet was small. Also, we had trouble getting to the breakfast area (perhaps someone was holding the elevator) so we had to use the stairs, which were filled with old matresses, boxes, supplies, rubbish etc. Not something one would expect in an expensive hotel. I did enjoy the fresh fruit waiting for me in the room when I got in, and the area in which the hotel was located had some great restaurants, still mainly unspoiled by tourists such as myself.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rekord - worth checking into”
Reviews.Author: SeamusBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Smal boutique/vest pocket hotel in the Sant Gervasi neighborhood in Barelona. We like that it was small and out of the way; i.e. - off the tourist-beaten track. You'll be in a neighborhood with the locals, local restaurants, etc. Half a block from the Linea 7 metro stop, an easy 4 stop ride to Plaza Catalunya. Minimalist decor, which we appreciated, and very helpful staff. They have an evening coffee service (6 to 9 PM), just the thing to charge your batteries before going out. Rates when we there were about 200 euros a night, and we felt this was a fair rate. We would definitely recommend this place, and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location!”
Reviews.Author: cmckee1980
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Rekord after reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We were after a 'boutique style' hotel in Barcelona in an area that didn't have the constant hustle and bustle of 'La Rambla' or the 'Gothic Quarter' and we certainly chose well. The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to stay somewhere that is a little quieter and isn't surrounded by tourist-trap bars and restaurants. It's not a hotel for lads or ladies on a party weekend as it's a little out of the way for access to hip entertainment areas such as 'el ravel' and 'el born'. The hotel is about 50 metres from the Muntaner FGC station which is only 3 stops from Placa Catalunya (it takes no more than 10 mins to get there). The Aerobus operates from Placa Catalunya which is a very cheap and convenient way to get to and from the airport. We found the FGC and Metro to be very efficient and easy to use (we always make a point of using the subway / metro / undergound systems wherever we travel so we are well used to reading the maps and making changeovers to get to our location). Francesc Macia Square is a 5 min walk from the hotel and you can catch the Bus Turistic here for both Northern and Southern routes. We would recommend the Bus Turistic as the best way to see the many sights and attractions Barcelona has to offer. Passeig de Gracia is about a 15 or 20 min walk away if you fancy a stroll in the sun rather than going underground on the FGC. We booked our hotel through the hotel website. Check-in was efficient and staff were always courteous. We knew very little Spanish or Catalan but this wasn't an issue as staff had an excellent grasp of English which made things a lot easier for us. The hotel lobby is very stylish yet small. There is only 1 lift to take guests to their room although this is adequate given the hotel's size and the fact there are only has 2 rooms per floor. We stayed in room 502 which was a 'Junior Suite' which was made up of a living area, bedroom and ensuite bathroom. The room was stylishly decorated in modern colours and felt every bit a 4 star hotel room. The room was immaculately clean and felt very spacious and airy. The complimentary 'plate of fruit' was very nice and the bathrobes and slippers set for each guest are little extra's that make you feel more than just another number through the door. The living area had a TV as did the bedroom. We didn't watch much TV at all (we never do when away) and although the selection of channels seemed fairly decent there was only 1 channel broadcasting in English (CNN). The room had a cabled internet connection and an eletronic safe both of which were very handy to have. My only gripe with the room was the bed which looked so inviting yet i never really had a comfortable night's sleep in it. It was harder than i'm used to and the pillows were a bit too soft and flimsy. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was excellent. The breakfast room is small yet comfortable and the selection and quality of food on offer was really good. It was a buffet style breakfast with all of the usual fruit, bread, cereals and cold meats on offer. There were also some hot food items available (eggs, sausages and bacon) although we didn't try these. There is an adjoining TV / reading area which is very cosy and offers complimentary tea/ coffee and biscuits etc from 6pm every evening. Both areas had wireless internet connections which i used without any difficulty. There were several restaurants in the area although we only visited 1 which was an Italian restaurant directly across the road (we fancied a change from all the tapas we were eating). We had to queue for some time even though we had made a reservation so it seems to be very popular with the locals. The food was very good and if you like Italian food you could do a whole lot worse than eat here. We also found a few places in the area selling lovely pastries and cakes if you have a sweet tooth. All in all, we had a great time in Barcelona and our stay at Hotel Rekord was everything we were after and more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in perfect position”
Reviews.Author: Poussis
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights this January. Hotel combines comfort and efficiency with charm and friendliness. All the staff, whether at reception or serving at breakfast, were extremely welcoming and helpful at all times. The room was huge and very well appointed - great bed, big modern bathroom, everything immaculately clean, including new white bathrobes and slippers laid out on the beds. It was also unusual in having a proper desk with sitting room area with sofas and chairs, so the room felt more like a small flat with office facilities. Also unusual for Europe were the coffee/tea-making facilities in each room. Breakfast was a vast buffet - enough to challenge the biggest appetites. You can also use the lounge area during the day and help yourself to tea, coffee and cakes up to 9 at night. On our first night, staff brought a plate of fresh sliced tropical fruit to the room. Good area too - Muntaner is a lively upmarket street, well connected to all parts of the city but away from the touristy bustle of the Ramblas area. Check out the Galvany covered market over the road if you get a chance. Generally first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: S28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed our time there very much. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were huge and I really liked the new, modern decor. Very different from some of the other hotels we've stayed in in Europe. The location was also good as the underground rail station was nearby. Plenty of surprises too, like a fruit plate on our first night there, a toy for my son, etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming city hotel”
Reviews.Author: kobri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in rekord Barcelona for 2 nights and are highly satisfied with the hotel. Actually, we wanted to book Casa Camper first, but then the friends told us about Rekord. So we have booked this hotel and were glad afterwards, we decided for it. The location is a nice residential street, yet pretty central, you need only 7 minutes by subway to La Rambla. And subway station is on the other side of the road. We used subway the first day, and taxis afterwards, because taxis are pretty cheap and you get a taxi anyware. Hotel is very clean and nice modern style. The staff was friendly and breakfast OK, you get everything you need to start the day with. The only disappointment was a check out, because the girl on reception couldn't really speak English or any other language. So we have soent the first 10 minutes explaining her, which address should be written on the invoice, and the next 10 minutes waiting for the invoice. The waiting was in vain, because the girl couldn't print it because of some problems with the printer, so we just payed and left without invoice, bacause we were in a hurry for the airport. We hope they send us the invoice per post as promised. In spite of this accident I highl reccomend this hotel for every one, who like the cosy,quiet and not overcrowded hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, price and service!”
Reviews.Author: bielefeld07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 3 days of our honeymoon in Catalonia. We booked it just a few days before arriving for a very reasonable price of around €90/night. Our stay there was great! Staff very friendly and spoke English, room had a living area and lots of extras like bathrobes, tea/coffee etc., only 3 underground stops from "Las Ramblas". All in all, everything we needed for the few days in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms , friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: Kyriaki
Reviews.Content: my family and our friends , seven persons stayed at the Rekord hotel on August 2007 .First of all i would like to mention how friendly and caring is the reception .Smiling Norlyn and Raluca always ready to fullfill all our needs ( they changed two of our rooms to superiors , with no extra charge ).Rooms and bathrooms huge, with so many toilettries .Breakfast and the staff in the small though satisfactory breakfast room very good ( taste the small sandwitches with tuna , either ham , or the small sausages etc.).Internet connection free .Two train stations ( not metro ) from Plaza Cataluna .Very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JoelleA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at 1200 following our flght from Dulles via Paris on Air France and we couldn't have been more pleased with the reception, accomodation and service. Our top floor room, the rear loft, very quiet, was uniquely decorated, quite large with a skylight, king size comfortable bed, comfy robes, desk, sofa, TV, stereo and exercise bike (didn't use with all the walking we did!). The single rose flower in the bath was a nice touch! Their breafast was fresh, abundant and well maintained. The staff was very helpful, from referring local restaurants (the italian one across the street is very good & mid-priced), to providing a laptop free in my room so I could deal with an urgent business problem. Its location is very convenient. We walked to the Sagrada Familia from the hotel (nice & easy), and walked back from Park Guell (it's mostly downhill). We used the Mutaneer metro station at the hotel corner to go "downtown" & back. The ranking on this hotel simply means it hasn't been discovered yet. That's fine for all the folks like us who like staying at "boutique" hotels with reasonable prices that delivers outstanding value and vacation enjoyment. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending two weeks in Spain and have to comment on Hotel Rekord. We loved this place. It was without doubt, the best place we stayed. I was concerned about the location because I thought that it was too far from the city centre. Hotel Rekord is 3 metro stops from the Ramblas. The metro stop is a stones throw (not kidding here) from the hotel. It took less that 10 minutes to get from the city centre to the hotel. The rooms are very nice. We stayed in rooms 201 and 402. Both were great. Room 402 was at the back of the hotel so it was quieter but the hotel is in such a quiet neighbourhood that even though 201 was streetside it was still relatively quiet. Room 402 was a suite. It had a sitting room with a desk and a separate bedroom. Room 201 is one big room. We loved both rooms. Both rooms are well equiped. They both have a kettle with the makings for coffee and tea. There was a plate of freshly cut fruit in the room on the day that we arrived. The rooms have at least one tv (the suite had one in the sitting room and one in the bedroom), a cd player, several phones, comfy bathrobes and slippers. The bathrooms are stocked with shampoo, soap, hair dryer etc. something that I took forgranted until we stayed at many other places that cost more and had none of these things. Breakfast was yummy. Lots of pastries, fresh fruit, cheese, eggs, bacon, sausages, cereal etc. The staff were also fabulous. We asked to borrow one of the laptops and it was brought to our room. When we couldn't get it to work, Susanna came up to help and ended up letting us using it in another room as our connection wasn't working. I highly recommend this hotel. The location is great, very quiet at night. Lots of beautiful shops nearby and close to transit.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPlus
Reviews.Content: This is truly a little gem in Barcelona. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are immaculate, breakfasts are generous, and the overall feeling is warm and welcoming. My friend and I shared a room that was in fact a junior suite - there was a sitting area with a comfy sofa and coffee table, a desk and chair (guests can borrow a laptop from Reception), and more than enough closet space. The marble walls and floor of the bathroom were nice and cool, and the biggest treat was a bathtub (as well as a shower) - unusual in European hotels. There is a bus stop across the road from the hotel, with two buses that go to Placa Catalunya, and a Metro station just a few steps past the bus stop. There's a grocery store no more than a four minute walk away, open until 2100, good for snacks as well as real food. The rooms are quiet, even though Carrer Muntaner is a main road - and there are three layers of curtain, so you can have as much or as little light as you wish. We were very happy with our stay, and wouldn't hesitate in the least to stay at the lovely little Hotel Rekord in the future.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RIUOchoRiosBride
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel and if I had known I would have stayed here more than one night. We had originally booked for another hotel (Parc Del Valles-read review) but we arrived in Barcelona one day early and had to find a place to stay. It was expensive (95 euros per night) but to be honest it was worth it. It is in a beautiful area of Barcelona. The staff are very friendly. They really do have a computer with internet access (I have learned that a lot of places lie about computer access). They have a beautiful lounge on the mezzanine with great music playing softly in the background. Refreshments (yogurt, fruit and beverages) are provided as well as breakfast in the morning. I would probably classify this as a boutique hotel. The room is decorated in a simple, contemporary style. The bathroom is spacious, airy, with all the amenities you would ever need. I cannot emphasize how great this place is...you will not regret it.
